dict.acceptation: 预感；预见；预料；先于…行动；
过早地提出；过早地考虑（或说、做）一件事；（在口头或用文字）预言；预测；

sent.orig: Jim did not anticipate any trouble, but we considered everything carefully and expected the worst.
sent.trans: 译文：吉姆没料到会有任何麻烦，但我们仔细考虑了一切，并做好了最坏的打算。

sent.orig: I anticipate success in effective economic control.
sent.trans: 我预料对经济的控制会获得成功的。

sent.orig: We must constantly pay attention to what we are doing and anticipate any potential safety hazards.
sent.trans: 我们必须时刻关注着我们所进行的工作，并且预见潜在的危险。

sent.orig: I anticipate dislocation, volatility and uncertainty accompanying the emergence of the new information economy.
sent.trans: 我认为错位、波动、不稳定等现象会随着新信息经济的出现而出现。
